Character Description:
Newspaper editor and businessman
Son of a hatter
Eventually ascends to newspaper owner and a commerical force
Usually features with journalists or financiers (Gaudissart, des Lupeaulx)
Name Variants: Andoche Finot, Finot, M. Finot, Monsieur Finot, M Finot
Major Appearances: ['SCENES FROM A COURTESANS LIFE', 'THE TWO BROTHERS', 'BUREAUCRACY', 'A DISTINGUISHED PROVINCIAL AT PARIS', 'THE FIRM OF NUCINGEN', 'BEATRIX', 'RISE AND FALL OF CESAR BIROTTEAU']
Minor Appearances: ['A PRINCE OF BOHEMIA', 'THE DEPUTY OF ARCIS', 'A DAUGHTER OF EVE', 'URSULA', 'THE ILLUSTRIOUS GAUDISSART', 'THE MAGIC SKIN', 'THE MUSE OF THE DEPARTMENT', 'A START IN LIFE']

Character Description:
Famous poet who rises to social prominence 
Ascends social ranks & administrative roles aided by his affair with the Duchesse de Chaulieu
Often features in high society scenes 
Often mentioned in the context of his poetry and songs
Name Variants: Baron de Canalis, Monsieur de Canalis, M de Canalis, de Canalis, Canalis
Major Appearances: ['THE DEPUTY OF ARCIS', 'UNCONSCIOUS COMEDIANS', 'A DISTINGUISHED PROVINCIAL AT PARIS', 'BEATRIX', 'MODESTE MIGNON']
Minor Appearances: ['LETTERS OF TWO BRIDES', 'HONORINE', 'SCENES FROM A COURTESANS LIFE', 'BUREAUCRACY', 'THE SECRETS OF THE PRINCESSE DE CADIGNAN', 'THE MAGIC SKIN', 'THE MUSE OF THE DEPARTMENT', 'TWO POETS', 'A START IN LIFE', 'ANOTHER STUDY OF WOMAN', 'THE COLLECTION OF ANTIQUITIES', 'ALBERT SAVARUS']

Character Description:
Wealthy banker and financier, connects multiple characters and plots via financing
Financial bougeoisie by social role; Alsatian by birth, first rises to wealth and prominence during the Restoration 
Husband of Delphine 
Lover of Esther van Gobseck, with whom he is passionately obsessed
Close associate of du Tillet and of Rastignac (who eventually becomes his son-in-law)
Balzac uses his name as a stand-in for wealth ("a Nucingen")
Name Variants: Baron de Nucingen, Monsieur de Nucingen, M de Nucingen, de Nucingen, Baron Frederic de Nucingen, Frederic de Nucingen, Nucingen, Frederic Nucingen
Major Appearances: ['THE BROTHERHOOD OF CONSOLATION', 'THE DEPUTY OF ARCIS', 'A DAUGHTER OF EVE', 'MELMOTH RECONCILED', 'UNCONSCIOUS COMEDIANS', 'SCENES FROM A COURTESANS LIFE', 'THE TWO BROTHERS', 'BUREAUCRACY', 'COUSIN BETTY', 'THE FIRM OF NUCINGEN', 'FATHER GORIOT', 'RISE AND FALL OF CESAR BIROTTEAU', 'ANOTHER STUDY OF WOMAN']
Minor Appearances: ['THE LESSER BOURGEOISIE', 'SARRASINE', 'GOBSECK', 'THE SECRETS OF THE PRINCESSE DE CADIGNAN', 'THE COMMISSION IN LUNACY', 'A DISTINGUISHED PROVINCIAL AT PARIS', 'THE GIRL WITH THE GOLDEN EYES', 'PIERRETTE', 'EVE AND DAVID', 'THE THIRTEEN', 'BEATRIX', 'THE MUSE OF THE DEPARTMENT', 'STUDY OF A WOMAN', 'THE COLLECTION OF ANTIQUITIES', 'EUGENIE GRANDET', 'SONS OF THE SOIL', 'A MAN OF BUSINESS', 'PAZ']

Character Description:
Social-climbing daughter of old Goriot, a wealthy vermicelli manufacturer
Financial bougeoisie by social role; becomes a society salon leader over time
Wife of Nucingen
Former lover of Henri de Marsay
Longtime lover (and later mother-in-law) of Rastignac
Name Variants: Baronne Delphine de Nucingen, Madame Delphine de Nucingen, Mme Delphine de Nucingen, Delphine, Delphine de Nucingen
Major Appearances: ['THE DEPUTY OF ARCIS', 'A DAUGHTER OF EVE', 'SCENES FROM A COURTESANS LIFE', 'THE FIRM OF NUCINGEN', 'FATHER GORIOT', 'RISE AND FALL OF CESAR BIROTTEAU']
Minor Appearances: ['BUREAUCRACY', 'THE SECRETS OF THE PRINCESSE DE CADIGNAN', 'THE THIRTEEN', 'ANOTHER STUDY OF WOMAN']

Character Description:
Social leader of Angouleme from provincial minor nobility
Becomes Baronne du Chatelet on her second marriage to Baron Sixte du Chatelet
Former lover of Lucien de Rubempre
Cousin of Marquise d'Espard
Name Variants:
Baronne Marie-Louise du Châtelet, Baronne Marie-Louise de Chatelet, Madame Marie-Louise du Châtelet, Mme Marie-Louise du Châtelet,
 Marie-Louise de Bargeton, Marie-Louise Anaïs de Bargeton,
 Madame de Bargeton,baronne du Châtelet, baronne du Chatelet, Baronne du Châtelet, Baronne du Chatelet, Louise de Negrepelesse, Louise de Nègrepelisse,
 Mme de Bargeton, Marie-Louise de Chatelet, Mme Marie-Louise du Châtelet, Madame du Chatelet, Madame du Châtelet, Louise du Chatelet
Major Appearances: ['SCENES FROM A COURTESANS LIFE', 'A DISTINGUISHED PROVINCIAL AT PARIS', 'EVE AND DAVID', 'TWO POETS']
Minor Appearances: ['BUREAUCRACY']

Character Description:
Commercial traveler and banker
Close associate of Ferdinand du Tillet and Nucingen, involved in less savory dealings
Eventually becomes bankrupt and emigrates
Name Variants: Charles Claparon, Claparon, M Claparon, Monsieur Claparon
Major Appearances: ['THE LESSER BOURGEOISIE', 'MELMOTH RECONCILED', 'THE TWO BROTHERS', 'THE FIRM OF NUCINGEN', 'RISE AND FALL OF CESAR BIROTTEAU', 'A MAN OF BUSINESS']

Character Description:
Newspaper critic famed for his wit and insight
Often features with other journalists 
Long-time lover of Mademoiselle des Touches
Mentor of the courtesan La Schontz (who becomes Mme. du Ronceret)
Name Variants: Claude Vignon, Vignon, M. Vignon, Monsieur Vignon
Major Appearances: ['UNCONSCIOUS COMEDIANS', 'A DISTINGUISHED PROVINCIAL AT PARIS', 'COUSIN BETTY', 'BEATRIX']
Minor Appearances: ['A DAUGHTER OF EVE', 'HONORINE', 'THE MAGIC SKIN', 'THE MUSE OF THE DEPARTMENT']

Character Description:
Son of a wealthy father ennobled under Louis XV
Politician who rises through social and administrative ranks, holds multiple high offices (Council of State, Finance Ministry, National Guard)
Powerful political intermediary for aristocratic interests
Socially prominent liberatine, usually features in high society scenes
Name Variants: Clement Chardin des Lupeaulx, Clément Chardin, Clement Chardin, Clément Chardin des Lupeaulx, Clement Chardin des Lupeaulx, des Lupeaulx, Comte des Lupeaulx, Lupeaulx
Major Appearances: ['SCENES FROM A COURTESANS LIFE', 'BUREAUCRACY', 'A DISTINGUISHED PROVINCIAL AT PARIS', 'SONS OF THE SOIL']
Minor Appearances: ['A PRINCE OF BOHEMIA', 'THE LESSER BOURGEOISIE', 'THE DEPUTY OF ARCIS', 'URSULA', 'THE TWO BROTHERS', 'THE FIRM OF NUCINGEN', 'EVE AND DAVID', 'RISE AND FALL OF CESAR BIROTTEAU', 'THE MUSE OF THE DEPARTMENT', 'THE COLLECTION OF ANTIQUITIES', 'EUGENIE GRANDET']

Character Description:
Head of a wealthy aristocratic family
Magistrate with important judicial & administrative roles
Unhappily married to Angelique de Granville 
Becomes father-in-law of Felix de Vandenesse and of Ferdinand du Tillet
Name Variants: Comte de Granville, Monsieur de Granville, M de Granville, de Granville, Grandville, Granville, Comte de Grandville, Monsieur de Grandville, Vicomte de Grandville
Major Appearances: ['A DAUGHTER OF EVE', 'HONORINE', 'SCENES FROM A COURTESANS LIFE', 'AN HISTORICAL MYSTERY', 'A SECOND HOME', 'RISE AND FALL OF CESAR BIROTTEAU']
Minor Appearances: ['THE LESSER BOURGEOISIE', 'THE DEPUTY OF ARCIS', 'THE MARRIAGE CONTRACT', 'BUREAUCRACY', 'THE FIRM OF NUCINGEN']

Character Description:
Powerful society leader from an aristocratic family
Became a count under the Empire and succeeded to several high government posts
Husband of Madame de Serizy, unhappily married
Name Variants:
Comte de Serizy, Monsieur de Serizy, M de Serizy, Comte Hugret de Serizy, Hugret de Serizy,
 Comte de Sérisy, Monsieur de Sérisy, M. de Sérisy, Comte de Sérizy,
 Monsieur de Sérizy, Hugret de Sérisy, Hugret de Sérizy, M de Sérizy, Hugret Serizy, Serizy, Serisy
Major Appearances: ['HONORINE', 'SCENES FROM A COURTESANS LIFE', 'THE TWO BROTHERS', 'A START IN LIFE']
Minor Appearances: ['THE MARRIAGE CONTRACT', 'BUREAUCRACY', 'THE SECRETS OF THE PRINCESSE DE CADIGNAN', 'THE COMMISSION IN LUNACY', 'FATHER GORIOT', 'SONS OF THE SOIL', 'MODESTE MIGNON']

Character Description:
Royal secretary
Dandy, fashionable salon frequenter
Connected to much of the featured nobility through family or marriage
Former lover of Lady Dudley, Natalie de Manerville, Madame de Mortsauf 
Marries Mlle. Marie-Angelique de Granville
His character is partially autobiographical, pulling from Balzac's own unhappy childhood and early romantic experiences
Name Variants: Comte Félix de Vandenesse, Comte Felix de Vandenesse, Comte de Vandenesse, Monsieur de Vandenesse, M de Vandenesse, Félix de Vandenesse, Felix de Vandenesse, Comte Félix-Amédée de Vandenesse, Felix-Amedee, Count Felix de Vandernesse, Vandenesse

Minor Appearances: ['LETTERS OF TWO BRIDES', 'AN HISTORICAL MYSTERY', 'THE FIRM OF NUCINGEN']

Character Description:
Dandy, fashionable salon frequenter
Notorious for affairs with the rich and famous, notably Anastasie Restaud & Sarah Gobseck (whom he ruins)
Protege and close associate of Henri de Marsay 
Eventually ascends to a department deputy in spite of his poor reputation
Name Variants: Comte Maxime de Trailles, Monsieur de Trailles, M de Trailles, Maxime de Trailles, Maxime, Trailles
Major Appearances: ['THE DEPUTY OF ARCIS', 'UNCONSCIOUS COMEDIANS', 'GOBSECK', 'THE SECRETS OF THE PRINCESSE DE CADIGNAN', 'FATHER GORIOT', 'BEATRIX', 'A MAN OF BUSINESS']

Character Description:
High society salon leader 
Born "Leontine de Ronquerolles", from a wealthy family and sister of the Marquis de Ronquerolles 
Wife of the Comte de Serizy, unhappily married and often unfaithful
Former lover of Lucien du Rubempre, a notably passionate affair

Comtesse de Serizy, Madame de Serizy, Mme de Serizy, Clara-Léontine de Ronquerolles, Léontine de Sérisy,
 Léontine de Sérizy, Léontine, Leontine de Serisy, Leontine de Serizy, Leontine de Ronquerolles,

Character Description:
Famous doctor
Teacher of Bianchon
Appears most often as a minor character, a consulting physician in illness scenes
Name Variants: Desplein, Monsieur Desplein, M Desplein, Doctor Desplein, Docteur Desplein
Major Appearances: ['SCENES FROM A COURTESANS LIFE', 'THE ATHEISTS MASS', 'MODESTE MIGNON']

Character Description:
Head of old, wealthy aristocratic family
Powerful society figure with pull in government and at court
Married to an Ajuda, connecting him to Portuguese aristocracy
Father to five daughters
Name Variants: Duc de Grandlieu, Monsieur de Grandlieu, M de Grandlieu, de Grandlieu, Ferdinand de Grandlieu, Duc Ferdinand de Grandlieu
Major Appearances: ['THE DUCHESSE OF LANGEAIS', 'SCENES FROM A COURTESANS LIFE', 'BEATRIX']
Minor Appearances: ['A DISTINGUISHED PROVINCIAL AT PARIS', 'AN HISTORICAL MYSTERY', 'MODESTE MIGNON']

Character Description:
Head of old, wealthy aristocratic family
Connected to many of the featured nobility through family or marriage
Powerful society figure with long-standing ties to the monarchy
Father of Madame de Mortsauf
Name Variants: Duc de Lenoncourt, Monsieur de Lenoncourt, M de Lenoncourt, de Lenoncourt, Lenoncourt
Major Appearances: ['RISE AND FALL OF CESAR BIROTTEAU', 'THE COLLECTION OF ANTIQUITIES', 'THE LILY OF THE VALLEY']

Character Description:
Head of old, wealthy aristocratic family
Powerful society figure with ties to many of the featured nobility through. patronage, family, or marriage
Father of the Duchesse de Langeais and cousin to the Marquise d'Espard
Patron to du Bruel
Name Variants: Duc de Navarreins, Monsieur de Navarreins, M de Navarreins, de Navarreins, Duke of Navarreins
Major Appearances: ['THE DUCHESSE OF LANGEAIS', 'A DISTINGUISHED PROVINCIAL AT PARIS', 'THE VILLAGE RECTOR', 'THE MUSE OF THE DEPARTMENT', 'THE COLLECTION OF ANTIQUITIES']

Character Description:
Son and heir to the Duc and Duchesse de Chaulieu
Dandy and society leader
Lover of Madame du Bruel (the dancer Tullia) for many years
Marries the Duchesse d'Argaiolo
Name Variants: Duc de Rhétoré, Duc de Rhetore, Monsieur de Rhétoré, M de Rhétoré, de Rhétoré, Duc de Rhetore, Monsieur de Rhetore, Duc de Rhetore, Alphonse de Rhetore, Alphonse de Rhétoré
Major Appearances: ['THE DEPUTY OF ARCIS', 'A DISTINGUISHED PROVINCIAL AT PARIS', 'MODESTE MIGNON']

Character Description:
Society leader considered the most powerful of the Parisian salon heads
Notorious for affairs with many of the rich and famous
Ascends to the title of Princesse de Cadignan upon her father-in-law's death (but abandoned by her husband)
Longtime enemy, later close friend of the Marquise d'Espard
Name Variants: Duchesse de Maufrigneuse, Madame de Maufrigneuse, Mme de Maufrigneuse, Diane de Maufrigneuse, Diane de Maufgrigneuse, Princesse de Cadignan, Diane de Cadignan, Princess Cadignan, Diane d'Uxelles

Character Description:
Journalist
Usually features with other journalists
Often provides sharply ironic observations about contemporary France
Marries Madame Viginie de Montcornet, a notably rare happy ending
Name Variants: Émile Blondet, Blondet, M Blondet, Monsieur Blondet, Emile Blondet,
Major Appearances: ['THE DEPUTY OF ARCIS', 'A DAUGHTER OF EVE', 'SCENES FROM A COURTESANS LIFE', 'THE SECRETS OF THE PRINCESSE DE CADIGNAN', 'A DISTINGUISHED PROVINCIAL AT PARIS', 'THE FIRM OF NUCINGEN', 'EVE AND DAVID', 'ANOTHER STUDY OF WOMAN', 'THE COLLECTION OF ANTIQUITIES', 'SONS OF THE SOIL']

Character Description:
Parisian critic and journalist
Close associate of Nathan and Finot and trained Lucien du Rubempre in journalism
Former lover of Madame Schontz/Madame du Ronceret
Name Variants: Etienne Lousteau, Lousteau, M Lousteau, Monsieur Lousteau
Major Appearances: ['THE LESSER BOURGEOISIE', 'A DAUGHTER OF EVE', 'SCENES FROM A COURTESANS LIFE', 'THE TWO BROTHERS', 'A DISTINGUISHED PROVINCIAL AT PARIS', 'COUSIN BETTY', 'EVE AND DAVID', 'BEATRIX', 'THE MUSE OF THE DEPARTMENT', 'A MAN OF BUSINESS']

Character Description:
Provincial minor noble turned Parisian dandy
Deftly moves between social groups 
Most frequent recurring character of La Comedie Humaine who typefies the social climber
Begins as a poor law student and ascends to title of Comte de Rasignac over the course of the series
Longtime lover (and eventual son-in-law) of Delphine de Nucingen, ascends to wealth via Nucingen affairs

Character Description:
Journalist
Often features with other journalists
Notable for his bitterness and unhappy marriage
Name Variants: Félicien Vernou, Felicien Vernou, Vernou, Monsieur Vernou, M Vernou
Major Appearances: ['SCENES FROM A COURTESANS LIFE', 'A DISTINGUISHED PROVINCIAL AT PARIS']
Minor Appearances: ['THE DEPUTY OF ARCIS', 'A DAUGHTER OF EVE', 'THE TWO BROTHERS', 'COUSIN BETTY']

Character Description:
Commercial traveler, formerly in the hat trade in the employ of Finot's father
Involved in various conspiracies and commercial schemes
Theatre owner
Name Variants: Felix Gaudissart, Gaudissart the Great, Gaudissart, M. Gaudissart, Monsieur Gaudissart
Major Appearances: ['COUSIN PONS', 'THE ILLUSTRIOUS GAUDISSART', 'GAUDISSART II', 'RISE AND FALL OF CESAR BIROTTEAU']

Character Description:
Commercial traveler and financier
Connects multiple characters and plots through finances, sometimes less savory dealings
Close associate of Nucingen and Claparon
Long-time lover of Madame Roguin
Name Variants: Ferdinand du Tillet, M. du Tillet, Monsieur du Tillet, Tillet, du Tillet, Ferdinand Tillet
Major Appearances: ['A DAUGHTER OF EVE', 'UNCONSCIOUS COMEDIANS', 'SCENES FROM A COURTESANS LIFE', 'THE TWO BROTHERS', 'COUSIN BETTY', 'THE FIRM OF NUCINGEN', 'RISE AND FALL OF CESAR BIROTTEAU']

Character Description:
Begins as a law clerk, becomes a succesful lawyer
Brother of Marie (the dancer Mariette) 
Often features in legal scenes involving petitions and contracts
Name Variants: Francois-Claude-Marie Godeschal, Godeschal
Major Appearances: ['THE LESSER BOURGEOISIE', 'COUSIN PONS', 'COLONEL CHABERT', 'A START IN LIFE']
Minor Appearances: ['THE TWO BROTHERS', 'THE COMMISSION IN LUNACY', 'THE FIRM OF NUCINGEN']

Character Description:
Born the son of a general and chevalier
Orphaned young and was patronized by Napoleon
Campaigned through Egypt and Africa, where he was held captive before his escape and return to Paris
Rises through military ranks, eventually ascending to general 
Member of the Thirteen secret society
Lover of the Duchesse de Langeais
Name Variants: Marquis de Montriveau, Monsieur General de Montriveau, M. General de Montriveau, General de Montriveau, Armand de Montriveau, Armand Montirveau, Marquis Armand, Montriveau, General Montriveau
Major Appearances: ['THE DUCHESSE OF LANGEAIS', 'A DISTINGUISHED PROVINCIAL AT PARIS']

Character Description:
Dandy and lover of many of the rich and famous (incl. Lady Dudley, whose children are his)
Illegitimate son of Lord Dudley
Member of the Thirteen secret society 
Represents a dark undercurrent in the upper class, his sinister dealings with women are often mentioned
Name Variants: Henri de Marsay, de Marsay, Monsieur de Marsay, M de Marsay, Marsay
Major Appearances: ['THE DUCHESSE OF LANGEAIS', 'THE DEPUTY OF ARCIS', 'A DAUGHTER OF EVE', 'URSULA', 'SCENES FROM A COURTESANS LIFE', 'THE MARRIAGE CONTRACT', 'THE TWO BROTHERS', 'THE SECRETS OF THE PRINCESSE DE CADIGNAN', 'A DISTINGUISHED PROVINCIAL AT PARIS', 'AN HISTORICAL MYSTERY', 'THE GIRL WITH THE GOLDEN EYES', 'FATHER GORIOT', 'RISE AND FALL OF CESAR BIROTTEAU', 'ANOTHER STUDY OF WOMAN', 'THE COLLECTION OF ANTIQUITIES', 'THE LILY OF THE VALLEY']

Character Description:
Famous artist who rises to social prominences throughout the novels
Often mentioned in context of his work (paintings, decorating homes)
Close associate of Bridau, de Lora, and Bixiou
Name Variants: Hippolyte Schinner, Schinner, Hippolyte, M. Schinner, Monsieur Schinner
Major Appearances: ['THE TWO BROTHERS', 'A START IN LIFE', 'THE PURSE', 'PIERRE GRASSOU']

Character Description:
Doctor who studied under Desplein 
Second most frequent recurring character in La Comedie Humaine
Appears most often as a minor character, consulting on an illness
Close friend of Rastignac
Balzac is said to have called for Bianchon on his deathbed

Character Description:
Criminal mastermind on the run from the law
His expoits eventually earn him a role as police chief
Patron of Lucien de Rubempre
Numerous false identities and aliases: Vautrin, Abbe Carlos Herrera, Trompe-la-Morte
Name Variants: Jacques Collin, Vautrin, Carlos Herrera, Abbé Carlos Herrera, Abbé Carlos, Abbe Carlos, Abbe Herrara, Abbé Herrera, Father Herrera, Trompe-la-Mort, Herrera, Monsieur Vautrin, M. Vautrin, William Barker, Father Carlos

Minor Appearances: ['THE LESSER BOURGEOISIE', 'COUSIN BETTY', 'EVE AND DAVID']

Character Description:
Wealthy civil servant and playwright
Sometimes referred to by the penname "Cursy"
Ascends to a peer of France and title of Comte
Marries the dancer Tullia, who is instrumental to his social rise
Name Variants: Jean Francois du Bruel, du Bruel, Bruel, Jean-Francois du Bruel, Cursy, Du Bruel
Major Appearances: ['A PRINCE OF BOHEMIA', 'THE TWO BROTHERS', 'BUREAUCRACY', 'A DISTINGUISHED PROVINCIAL AT PARIS']

Character Description:
Famous caricature artist who rises to social prominence throughout the novels
Obtains an administrative role through Duc de Maufrigneuse and Duc de Rhetore, earning financial stability
Usually features in company of journalists or artists
Close associate of Bridau, de Lora, and Schinner
Known for his incisive wit
Name Variants: Bixiou, Jean-Jacques Bixiou, Monsieur Bixiou, M. Bixiou, Jean Jacques Bixiou
Major Appearances: ['THE DEPUTY OF ARCIS', 'UNCONSCIOUS COMEDIANS', 'SCENES FROM A COURTESANS LIFE', 'THE TWO BROTHERS', 'BUREAUCRACY', 'GAUDISSART II', 'THE MAGIC SKIN', 'A DISTINGUISHED PROVINCIAL AT PARIS', 'COUSIN BETTY', 'THE FIRM OF NUCINGEN', 'BEATRIX', 'THE MUSE OF THE DEPARTMENT', 'A MAN OF BUSINESS']

Character Description:
Famous painter who rises to social prominence throughout the novels
Usually features in company of the Parisian artists' circle
Raised as the "black sheep" of a military family
Often mentioned in the context of his work (paintings, decorating homes)
Close associate of Bixiou, de Lora, and Schinner
Name Variants: Joseph Bridau, Monsieur Joseph Bridau, M Joseph Bridau
Major Appearances: ['THE DEPUTY OF ARCIS', 'THE TWO BROTHERS', 'A DISTINGUISHED PROVINCIAL AT PARIS', 'A START IN LIFE']
Minor Appearances: ['THE LESSER BOURGEOISIE', 'LETTERS OF TWO BRIDES', 'A DAUGHTER OF EVE', 'BUREAUCRACY', 'COUSIN BETTY', 'ANOTHER STUDY OF WOMAN', 'THE PURSE', 'PIERRE GRASSOU']

Character Description:
English aristocrat of searing wit notorious for her affairs with the rich and famous
Estranged wife of Lord Dudley
Former lover of Felix de Vandenesse, becomes an enemy to him and later his wife
Henri de Marsay is the father of her children
Name Variants: Madame Arabella Dudley, Mme Arabella Dudley, Lady Dudley, Arabella Dudley, Arabella, Lady Arabella, Lady Arabella Dudley, Marchioness of Dudley
Major Appearances: ['A DAUGHTER OF EVE', 'THE LILY OF THE VALLEY']
Minor Appearances: ['THE BALL AT SCEAUX', 'LETTERS OF TWO BRIDES', 'URSULA', 'THE COMMISSION IN LUNACY', 'THE MAGIC SKIN', 'THE MUSE OF THE DEPARTMENT', 'ANOTHER STUDY OF WOMAN']

Character Description:
Famous artist
Usually features in company of Bridau or other artists
Known as "Mistigris" and often mentioned in context of his works (especially landscapes)
Name Variants: Leon de Lora, Mistigris, de Lora, M. de Lora, Monsieur de Lora
Major Appearances: ['UNCONSCIOUS COMEDIANS', 'HONORINE', 'COUSIN BETTY', 'BEATRIX', 'A START IN LIFE']
Minor Appearances: ['THE DEPUTY OF ARCIS', 'SCENES FROM A COURTESANS LIFE', 'THE TWO BROTHERS', 'FATHER GORIOT', 'PIERRE GRASSOU']

Character Description:
Powerful English aristocrat and statesman 
Illegitimate father of Henri de Marsay
Husband of Lady Dudley
Known for his immorality and numerous mistresses
Name Variants: Lord Dudley, Monsieur Dudley, M Dudley, Dudley
Major Appearances: ['THE GIRL WITH THE GOLDEN EYES', 'ANOTHER STUDY OF WOMAN']
Minor Appearances: ['THE BALL AT SCEAUX', 'A DAUGHTER OF EVE', 'THE TWO BROTHERS', 'THE COLLECTION OF ANTIQUITIES', 'A MAN OF BUSINESS', 'THE LILY OF THE VALLEY']

Character Description:
Provincial celebrity turned Parisian social-climber
Born to a tradesman father and aristocratic mother, seeks to re-establish his family's noble name and title
Begins as a poet, becomes a journalist
Lover of many of the rich and famous, including Coralie and Esther Gobseck (both of whom he ruins)
Ascends to wealth as accomplice and would-be protege of Jacques Collin
Name Variants: Lucien, Lucien Chardon, Lucien de Rubempré, Monsieur de Rubempré, Monsieur Chardon, M Chardon, Lucien de Rubempre, Lucien de Rubempré
Major Appearances: ['SCENES FROM A COURTESANS LIFE', 'A DISTINGUISHED PROVINCIAL AT PARIS', 'EVE AND DAVID', 'TWO POETS']

Character Description:
Famous actress and social-climbing socialite
Kept mistress to many of the rich and famous
Longtime lover and eventual wife of Raoul Nathan
Name Variants: Florine, Florine Nathan, Madame Nathan, Madame Raoul Nathan, Madame Florine Nathan, Sophie Grignault
Major Appearances: ['A DAUGHTER OF EVE', 'SCENES FROM A COURTESANS LIFE', 'THE TWO BROTHERS', 'A DISTINGUISHED PROVINCIAL AT PARIS', 'EVE AND DAVID', 'THE MUSE OF THE DEPARTMENT', 'A START IN LIFE']

Character Description:
Formerly "Madame Schontz," a courtesan famed for her intelligence and wit
Former mistress of Lousteau, then Stidmann & often features with artists and critics
Marries Fabien du Ronceret, a judicial official
Name Variants: Madame du Ronceret, Josephine Schiltz, Josephine du Ronceret, Mademoiselle Schiltz, La petite Aurelie, Madame Schontz, Little Aurelie, Aurelie Schontz, Schontz
Major Appearances: ['COUSIN BETTY', 'BEATRIX', 'THE MUSE OF THE DEPARTMENT']
Minor Appearances: ['UNCONSCIOUS COMEDIANS']

Character Description:
Wealthy provinical bourgeouisie 
Wife of Roguin and daughter of a banker
Long-time mistress of Ferdinand du Tillet
Name Variants: Madame Roguin, Mme. Roguin, Mlle. Chevrel, Demoiselle Chevrel
Major Appearances: ['AT THE SIGN OF THE CAT AND RACKET', 'RISE AND FALL OF CESAR BIROTTEAU']

Character Description:
Famous writer known as "Camille Maupin"
Society host often surrounded by artists
Wealthy patron of the arts from a wealthy aristocratic family 
Heavily inspired by George Sand
Name Variants: Mademoiselle des Touches, Félicité des Touches, Felicite des Touches, Camille Maupin
Major Appearances: ['HONORINE', 'A DISTINGUISHED PROVINCIAL AT PARIS', 'BEATRIX', 'ANOTHER STUDY OF WOMAN']

Character Description:
Military general, ascends to social prominence via earned wealth and rank 
Napoleonic officer turned marshal, count, and army commander under the July Monarchy
Becomes a wealthy landowner but struggles to fit in with the aristocracy due to his temperament and character
First husband of Virginie Blondet (Mme. de Montcornet) and has ties to the artistic circles through her
Name Variants: Marechal de Montcornet, General de Montcornet, Comte de Montcornet, Monsieur Marechal de Montcornet, M Marechal  de Montcornet, Marechal de Montcornet, Marechal de Montcornet, Montcornet, Vicomte de Montcornet, General Montcornet, Marshal Montcornet

Character Description:
Head of old aristocratic family 
Diplomat, later deputy of a department in Bourgogne
Often features in high society scenes
Brother of Madame de Serizy
Member of the Thirteen secret society
Name Variants: Marquis de Ronquerolles, Monsieur de Ronquerolles, M de Ronquerolles, de Ronquerolles
Major Appearances: ['THE DUCHESSE OF LANGEAIS', 'THE DEPUTY OF ARCIS', 'THE THIRTEEN', 'SONS OF THE SOIL', 'PAZ']

Character Description:
Influential politician, ascends to social prominence via rising through administrative roles
Served Empire, Bourbons, and July Monarchy
Eventually becomes brother-in-law to Rastignac, who arranges his marriage with one of his sisters

Character Description:
Poet, writer, and sometimes journalist
Social-climbing son of a haberdasher 
Close associate of Blondet, Finot, du Bruel

Longtime lover and eventual husband of the actress Florine

Character Description:
Famous sculptor
Generally mentioned in the context of his work (decorative pieces, monuments)

Character Description:
Cousin of Rastignac
Eventually Comtesse, then Marquise de Beauseant
Absconds from la mode brillant following the end of a love affair with the Marquis d'Ajuda-Pinto

Born provincial nobility Virginie de Troisville, marries Marechal de Montcornet 
Society host of artists and intellectuals
Marries Emile Blondet upon the death of Montcornet, a notable happy ending
